item.title: Recycle Video Games and Gaming Systems
item.description:
Think about all the video games and gaming systems you have in your home, even the ones tucked away. You probably have quite a collection! Wouldn’t it be great to turn those unused games and consoles into cash? Instead of letting them gather dust, you could use the money to buy whatever you want, including the newest games and systems. Selling your old gaming stuff can be a hassle, but it doesn’t have to be...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/recycle-video-games-and-gaming-systems/

item.title: Beogram 4000: End Groove Detection Issue
item.description:
Following the hood polishing, I believed my work on this Beogram 4000 was complete, but I was mistaken. A final functionality test before packing revealed a peculiar issue. When the ON button was pressed without a record on the platter, the carriage would move inward as expected, but then halt abruptly before reaching the end switch (ES). Pressing FF would release it, but the carriage would instantly retract without contacting the ES...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-end-groove-detection-issue/

item.title: Beogram 4000: An Entertaining Evening Exploring the Differential Stop Circuit
item.description:
Before returning a refurbished unit to a customer, we put it through rigorous real-world testing. This involves playing music for several weeks to ensure consistent functionality. This listening process is a delightful part of working with Bang & Olufsen equipment, as our workshop is always filled with music! A recent case involving a restored Beogram 4000 turntable highlights the value of this testing phase. During playback, I noticed the arm occasionally failed to return to its resting position after reaching the record’s end...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-an-entertaining-evening-exploring-the-differential-stop-circuit/
